NEW YORK, Sept. 23, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- About general lightingGeneral lighting includes incandescent, fluorescent, LED, and tungsten photonic lighting. LED lighting devices have advantages such as high-intensity brightness, low voltage and current requirements, low radiated heat, high reliability, negligible UV rays, and a long lifespan. With such advantages, LED lights are easily adopted, thus, increasing the penetration of LED in the general lighting market.Technavio's analysts forecast the general lighting in Brazil market to grow at a CAGR of 13.82% over the period 2014-2019.Covered in this reportThis report covers the present scenario and growth prospects of the general lighting market in Brazil during 2015-2019. To calculate the market size, the report considers revenue generated from the residential, commercial, industrial, architecture, and outdoor segments. The report also covers the technology landscape of the lighting industry and provides an understanding of the LED lighting supply chain. The report presents an overview of Brazil, stating significant facts and information influencing the growth of the market. In this report, the market has been categorized based on the following:- Application: Residential, commercial, industrial, architectural, and outdoor segments- Type: LED and traditional lighting- Technology: CFL, halogen, HID, LED, LFL, and incandescent lighting- Form: Luminaire and replacementTechnavio's report, General Lighting in Brazil Market 2015-2019, has been prepared based on an in-depth market analysis with inputs from industry experts. It also discusses the key vendors operating in this market. The report focuses on the market landscape and its growth prospects in the coming years. In addition, the report discusses the major drivers that influence the growth of the market.
